techmeme.title: French prosecutors open an investigation into Australian video platform Kick over the death of a content creator who was violently abused during livestreams (Graham Fraser/BBC)
Sources and docs: Microsoft worked with the FBI to track anti-Israel protests, flagged internal emails with words like "Gaza", deleted posts, and fired staff (Bloomberg)
Sources: Klarna seeks a $13B to $14B valuation in its IPO next month, selling shares for $34-$36 as early as this week; Klarna sought a ~$50B valuation in 2021 (Reuters)
Sources: Temu resumes shipping goods from China directly to US consumers and increases its US ad spending, after a trade truce between Washington and Beijing (Financial Times)
AT&T agrees to buy spectrum licenses from EchoStar for ~$23B in cash, adding 50MHz of low-band and mid-band spectrum, set to close by mid-2026 (Olivia Solon/Bloomberg)
